intro: Martrasia sericea, commonly known as the silky martrasia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely haired leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine, silken layer of hair, giving it its common name. Martrasia sericea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
